etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in British Journal of Dermatology. From angio- + keratoma, after Italian angiocheratoma

definitions: A lesion of the skin consisting of an area of dilated blood vessels covered by a wart-like thickening of the overlying epithelium; (also) any of several conditions characterized by the presence of such lesions.

notes.text: The presence of multiple angiokeratomas is particularly characteristic of, but diagnostic of, a genetic disorder of glycosphingolipid metabolism, Fabry's disease.
